meanings.definition: To reveal one's thoughts or feelings
meanings.sent1: She decided to unbosom her worries to her best friend.
meanings.sent2: It is important to unbosom your emotions to those you trust.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but unbosom his excitement about the upcoming trip.
meanings.sent4: The diary seemed to unbosom all her deepest secrets.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet of the night, she finally unbosomed her fears.

meanings.sent2: It's comforting to have someone to unbosom your worries to.
meanings.sent3: He always knew he could unbosom his secrets to his loyal dog.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to unbosom the tales whispered to it by passersby.
meanings.sent5: She felt relieved after unbosoming her concerns to her mentor.

meanings.definition: To disclose or share something personal
meanings.sent1: She decided to unbosom her dreams of traveling the world.
meanings.sent2: It takes courage to unbosom your innermost thoughts to others.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist the urge to unbosom his love for chocolate.
meanings.sent4: The painting seemed to unbosom the artist's hidden emotions.
meanings.sent5: In the warmth of the campfire, they unbosomed their childhood memories.
